Text: That’s all from me today and for this week. We’ll be back from 6.30am on Monday for more breaking news. Hope you have a great weekend! Ex-Emmerdale star Charlie Hardwick led the way in celebrating the achievements of North East ‘superwomen’ at the Sunshine Fund’s Glass Slipper Awards. The Wallsend-born actress, famous for playing Val Pollard in the ITV soap, was guest speaker at this year’s celebration at Hilton NewcastleGateshead which saw awards go to seven high-fliers, including well-known former presenter Lyn Spencer. The afternoon event, now in its fourth year, began with a champagne reception before Charlie entertained guests with her own story of triumphing against the odds. She told how her childhood dreams of being an artist were crushed by a general attitude of not taking girls seriously. More from the glittering awards ceremony. Here’s what firefighters have been called out to this evening: A frosty start tomorrow. Cloud will be broken with some sunny intervals and isolated light wintry showers. Light easterly winds will lift temperatures near coasts, but feeling colder inland. Maximum temperature 5C. Here’s what’s tomorrow’s back page will look like, before it even hits the printing presses. Ayoze Perez insists he is ready to answer the call for Newcastle United and play as a lone forward at Stoke City if required. Aleksandar Mitrovic and Papiss Cisse are back in training, but both are unlikely to be fit enough to start the match at The Britannia Stadium on Wednesday night. Instead, 22-year-old forward Perez - who signed a new five-and-a-half year contract earlier this month - could be deployed as a lone frontman, just as he was at Everton. Full comments from Perez. Many people will have fallen off the new year detox wagon by now so if you’re after some stodge to reward yourself for being good or maybe just have a massive appetite Osbornes bar in Jesmond might have just the challenge for you. Man vs Osbornes lays down the culinary gauntlet with three challenges for you to get your chops round. All Oliver Whalley wants is to go to school. But the 10-year-old is quickly falling behind in his education after not stepping foot in a classroom this year. Now his parents fear Oliver’s health problems are preventing him getting the school place he so desperately needs. More on the fight to get Oliver into school. Police are appealing for information after a number of catering vans have been targeted in the Team Valley Trading Estate. In the last couple of weeks police have received five reports of catering vans and caravans having been broken into on the estate. The offences have occurred in the Earlsway, Tenth Avenue, Eleventh Avenue, New Road and Queensway South areas. The thieves are forcing their way into the caravans by damaging locks, doors and even cutting holes to get inside before stealing items including money, catering equipment and generators. Anyone with any information into the recent break-ins is asked to contact police in Gateshead on 101quoting reference number 141 25/02/16. Take an early look at tomorrow’s front page with all of the latest coverage from the Adam Johnson trial. It’s now safe to cross over to Holy Island using the Lindisfarne Causeway Road. It will stay safe until 3.15am. It will be a freezing start to tomorrow, and unlike the sunny days we’ve been having this week, it will stay overcast. Showers are expected in the evening but winds will be light. Jurors tasked with determining whether Adam Johnson is guilty of two sex acts with a child have been urged to convict the man who “unscrupulously manipulated” her. Prosecutors described the sacked Sunderland footballer as an arrogant man who “lied, lied and lied again”, while giving their closing speeches. Kate Blackwell QC said: “He had everything, a glittering career, a beautiful girlfriend, handsome home, healthy new baby daughter, more money than he could possibly spend. What did he do? He cheated on his girlfriend, lied to her and manipulated her in way that shows his exceptional duplicity.” She added: “He lied to police, he lied to his girlfriend, his family. These are lies he has admitted to but the prosecution alleges that he has lied to you the jury. He is lying that it went no further than a kiss.” More on today’s hearing. Here’s the best from sport this evening. Race meeting at Newcastle Racecourse tomorrow with gates opening around 11.50am. The first race is at 1.50pm and the last is at 5.05pm. Expect extra traffic on the A1 and the Great North Road until 6.30pm. We’ve been collecting pictures across the North East after dark, and the latest instalment features Sunderland at night. See the city lit up despite the cold winter nights. A candlelit vigil to “reclaim” Heaton Park drew more than 100 people who marched in solidarity after a woman was raped there. The 22-year-old victim was walking through the park between 10.50pm and 11.10pm on February 21 when the attacker pounced. Locals, refusing to be intimidated by the horrific crime, showed support by gathering together at the scene for a minute of silence on Thursday. Another frosty night is in store with some wintry showers forecast. It will stay cold and cloudy throughout the weekend. A fire crew from Hebburn are dealing with a car on fire in the Wardley area of Gateshead now. The curtain’s about to go down on February but from robots to snakes there’s plenty of fun to squeeze in this weekend. From an robotic exhibition at the Centre of Life to a snake encounter, here’s a list of ideas to keep the kids entertained. The latest from the Adam Johnson trial and more top news. No major delays to report from Newcastle Airport this evening. All planes are taking off and landing to the schedule. Motorists are being urged to make sure they secure their vehicles after a spate of vehicle thefts in the west of Sunderland. Overnight on Saturday February 13 into Sunday February 14 a vehicle was stolen after it had been left parked in Clinton Place. On Monday February 15 a motorbike was stolen from outside a house in Thistle Road. Thieves picked up the bike and put it into the rear boot of a vehicle before driving off. And on Monday February 22 a scooter was taken from Goole Road - it had been left insecure in a rear yard. It’s believed the bike was pushed away. Officers are carrying out inquiries into the incidents and appealing for information. Anyone with information is asked to contact Northumbria Police on 101 quoting reference 305 140216 or Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111. Sunderland face West Ham tomorrow - but what are the predictions of our resident SAFC expert? Sunderland writer James Hunter gives a preview of tomorrow’s match and whether he thinks the Black Cats can come out on top. Fire investigators are no closer to discovering the cause of a Newcastle city centre blaze that destroyed an iconic shop and killed the owner. Three months after Kard Bar burst into flames and killed owner Brian Sandells, 81, inquiries into the cause of the fire continue. Fire officers and a dog unit have been seen routinely inspecting the building- but as of yet the cause of the blaze has not been established. More on the devastating blaze. There will be no Metro trains between Airport and South Gosforth all day on Sunday as modernisation work takes place. Replacement bus 900 will call at or close to all stations in the affected area. At Callerton Parkway, the replacement bus stop outside of the station will not be in use. Buses will use the two stops located on the B6918 road. Trains will be running elsewhere on the system but may not run to the usual timetable. Passengers are warned their journey will take longer so they are asked to allow extra time for travel. Still heavy traffic on the A167 Central Motorway but delays aren’t too bad. No major incidents to report on the roads so far this evening. Mainly dry this evening with long clear periods. This will allow a widespread frost to form. A few light wintry showers may affect coastal areas.. Minimum temperature tonight will be -3C. Here’s the best read news and sport this evening. Police investigating a common assault on a 13-year-old are appealing for information. The incident happened around 5.24pm yesterday near to Oxclose Comprehensive School in Oxclose when the girl was approached by a man who assaulted her. The girl was not injured in the incident. Inquiries are ongoing to establish the circumstances around the incident and police are appealing for witnesses. The offender is described as male, with a shaven bald head and wearing a distinctive black and orange tracksuit. Anyone with information is asked to contact Northumbria Police on 101 quoting reference 834 260216 quoting reference 0800 555 111.
